children.text: Okay, I need to translate this Java code to C. Let's start by understanding what the Java code does. The Java code reads two integers, n and m. Then it uses two queues, q1 and q2.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: q1 stores the initial values (probably the number of candies each child wants, or something similar), and q2 stores the indices of the children. The process is simulating giving out m candies each time. If a child needs more than m, they go to the back of the queue with the remaining amount. The last child to be processed (when their required candies drop to m or less) is the answer.
children.label: mental_execution

children.text: In C, there's no built-in queue data structure, so I'll have to implement it using arrays and manage the front and rear pointers manually. Let's think about how to do that.
